document.masterDocTitle: A sympatric species pair: Spogostylum ocyale (Wiedemann, 1828) and S. griseipenne Macquart, 1850 (Diptera: Bombyliidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A sympatric species pair: Spogostylum ocyale (Wiedemann, 1828) and S. griseipenne Macquart, 1850 (Diptera: Bombyliidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Spogostylum sordidum Sack,
Greathead, 1980
: 320
( Saudi Arabia , females)

subSubSection.paragraph:
The syntype specimen of
S. ocyale Wiedemann
labelled ‘Nubien Ruppel’ in ZMHB was examined by N. L. Evenhuis and designated lectotype (
Evenhuis & Greathead, 1999
). This specimen has no spot on the interradial vein. The holotype of
S. umbra Walker
in BMNH was also examined and is a very dark specimen without the spot on the interradial vein. Similar dark specimens in the author’s collection have a pointed aedeagus, thus
S. umbra
was designated a synonym of
S. ocyale
.
Theodor ( 1983 : Figs 594­597 )
correctly identified
S. ocyale
. However,
Zaitzev ( 1997 )
reversed Theodor’s designation of the two forms and described
S. ocyale
as
S. arugotense
.
Greathead ( 1980 b)
identified very dark specimens resembling
S. ocyale
as
S. sordidum
but re­examination shows that the females are
S. ocyale
.

Diagnosis. Interradial vein not infuscated (
Fig. 1
). Male with aedeagus shorter and pointed (
Fig. 3
:
Theodor, 1983
: Fig. 596 :
Greathead, 1967
: Fig. 50 ). Female with spermathecal bulb broad at base and tapering toward apex (
Fig. 5
:
Theodor, 1983
: Fig. 597 ). Specimens show the full range of coloration from very dark to very pale.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1­2. Wings of
Spogostylum
species. 1.
S. ocyale (Wiedemann)
. 2.
S. griseipenne (Macquart)
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Afrotropical: Somalia , Sudan , Yemen . Palaearctic: Egypt , Libya , Oman , ‘Palestine’, Saudi Arabia , United Arab Emirates .
